claims.claim: The global yarn market is expected to grow by USD 39.9 billion from 2025-2029, at a CAGR of 5.3%
The global knitting yarn market was valued at USD 7,177.3 million in 2024 and is expected to reach USD 9,965.3 million by 2031 (CAGR 4.8%)
The global Knitting and Crochet Market is expected to grow USD 12,279.9 million from 2025-2029, at a CAGR of 6.9%
Swiss online retailer Galaxus reported that sales of knitting needles, sewing machines, fabric scissors and wool rose by 646% from April 2020 to March 2021
Knitting pattern sales increased by 25% during the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020
Lion Brand (143-year-old yarn company) sales were up 80% since coronavirus lockdowns began
In 2020, The Guardian reported a 140% increase in the number of people taking up crochet
We Are Knitters sales increased 75% each week during the pandemic crisis, with social media following growing by 50%
Etsy more than doubled its revenues in 2020, with sales up 39% for first nine months of 2021
The average age of yarn consumers is 58 (median 59); 98% are female with household income between $72,000-$91,500
48% of yarn consumers are retired; 31% employed full-time; 73% crochet, 84% knit, 58% do both
There are over 7.3 million knitters in the UK and 53 million knitters in the USA
The hashtag #knittok has over 1.1 billion views on TikTok
The hashtag #crochet has 13.9 billion views on TikTok
PetiteKnit (Mette Wendelboe Okkels) has over 1 million Instagram followers
Crochet influencer Monet Nejon has 3.3 million TikTok followers
European shoulder construction remains a top trend, popularized by Scandinavian designs like PetiteKnit's Lyon Sweater
Texture techniques are trending: cables, popcorn stitches, brioche, Fishermen's Rib, bobbles
Chunky and oversized knitting projects continue trending in 2025 as statement pieces
Pantone Color of the Year 2025 is Mocha Mousse (earthy brown)
Blue paired with white is a standout color combination for colorwork in 2024-2025
Marling technique (pairing two contrasting colors for heathered look) is trending
Dickies/collars/cowls are trending as the evolution from balaclavas popularity
Eco-friendly yarns (organic cotton, bamboo, recycled) are increasingly popular due to ecological benefits
Upcycling trend: crafters repurposing old knits, using yarn from thrifted garments for patchwork pieces
Quiet luxury trend: minimalist silhouettes, premium natural fibers, understated elegance
90% of surveyed knitters/crocheters reported feeling calmer; 80% reported increased happiness (University of Wollongong study, n=8,000)
10% of mental health clinics have integrated knitting into therapeutic programs
70% of new knitters cite relaxation and stress relief as their primary reason for starting
Ravelry's June 2020 redesign caused reports of seizures (~8 users), migraines, eye strain, and accessibility issues
Ravelry has 9 million registered users and 1 million monthly active users
Ravelry accessibility issues remain unresolved as of late 2024
BIPOC in Fiber directory (originally created by Jeanette Sloan in 2018) supports Black, Indigenous and POC fiber artists
Vogue Knitting established a Diversity Advisory Council (DAC) - first of its kind in the knitting community
#blackpeopledoknit hashtag created by designer Lorna Hamilton Brown to promote Black visibility in knitting
Tom Daley went viral at 2020 Tokyo Olympics for crocheting poolside, creating his famous Tokyo 2020 Cardigan
Wool yarns most popular among consumers, followed by blended fibers, synthetic, cotton; only 2% prefer luxury yarns
Modern granny squares featuring geometric patterns, hexagons, floral designs, and bold colors are trending
Gender-inclusive patterns with broader sizing and universal appeal are a growing trend
Multi-craft combinations blending knitting/crochet with applique, cross stitch, embroidery, beadwork are trending
